webwork-tex.statement: Suppose \(\vec{F}(x,y) = -y \vec{i} + x \vec{j}\) and \(C\) is the line segment from point \(P = \left(5,0\right)\) to \(Q = \left(0,2\right)\). \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (a) Find a vector parametric equation \(\vec{r}(t)\) for the line segment \(C\) so that points \(P\) and \(Q\) correspond to \(t = 0\) and \(t = 1\), respectively. \leavevmode\\\relax \(\vec{r}(t) =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{20ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (b) Using the parametrization in part (a), the line integral of \(\vec{F}\) along \(C\) is \leavevmode\\\relax \(\displaystyle \int_C \vec{F} \cdot d \vec{r} = \int_a^b \vec{F}(\vec{r}(t)) \cdot \vec{r}\,'(t) \, dt = \int_a^b\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{20ex}{\hrulefill}} \(dt\) \leavevmode\\\relax with limits of integration \(a =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{5ex}{\hrulefill}} and \(b =\) \mbox{\parbox[t]{5ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (c) Evaluate the line integral in part (b). \leavevmode\\\relax \mbox{\parbox[t]{10ex}{\hrulefill}} \leavevmode\\\relax \leavevmode\\\relax (d) What is the line integral of \(\vec{F}\) around the clockwise-oriented triangle with corners at the origin, \(P\), and \(Q\)? Hint: Sketch the vector field and the triangle. \leavevmode\\\relax \mbox{\parbox[t]{10ex}{\hrulefill}}
